articles.author: Anil Ananthaswamy
articles.description:
We insist that large language models repeatedly translate their mathematical processes into words. There may be a better way.            
The post To Make Language Models Work Better, Researchers Sidestep Language first appeared on Quanta Magazine
articles.title: To Make Language Models Work Better, Researchers Sidestep Language

articles.author: Shalma Wegsman
articles.description:
A new proposal makes the case that paraparticles — a new category of quantum particle — could be created in exotic materials.             
The post ‘Paraparticles’ Would Be a Third Kingdom of Quantum Particle first appeared on Quanta Magazine
articles.title: ‘Paraparticles’ Would Be a Third Kingdom of Quantum Particle

articles.author: Joseph Howlett
articles.description:
The mathematician Tai-Danae Bradley is using category theory to try to understand both human and AI-generated language.            
The post Where Does Meaning Live in a Sentence? Math Might Tell Us. first appeared on Quanta Magazine
articles.title: Where Does Meaning Live in a Sentence? Math Might Tell Us.

articles.author: Yasemin Saplakoglu
articles.description:
Complex neural pathways likely arose independently in birds and mammals, suggesting that vertebrates evolved intelligence multiple times.            
The post Intelligence Evolved at Least Twice in Vertebrate Animals first appeared on Quanta Magazine
articles.title: Intelligence Evolved at Least Twice in Vertebrate Animals

articles.author: Ben Brubaker
articles.description:
When pigeons outnumber pigeonholes, some birds must double up. This obvious statement — and its inverse — have deep connections to many areas of math and computer science.             
The post How a Problem About Pigeons Powers Complexity Theory first appeared on Quanta Magazine
articles.title: How a Problem About Pigeons Powers Complexity Theory
